name: Format\Layout
description: The object for defining columns, gutters, and margins for your article’s designed width.

properties.name: columns
properties.description: The number of columns this article was designed for. You must have at least one column.

properties.name: gutter
properties.description: The gutter size for the article (in points). The gutter provides spacing between columns. This property should always be an even number; odd numbers are rounded up to the next even number. If this property is omitted, a default gutter size of 20 is applied. If the gutter is negative, the number will be set to 0.

properties.name: margin
properties.description: The outer (left and right) margins of the article, in points. If this property is omitted, a default article margin of 60 is applied. If the margin is negative, the number will be set to 0. If the margin is greater than or equal to the width/2, the article delivery will fail.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width (in points) this article was designed for. This property is used to calculate down-scaling scenarios for smaller devices.
